episodeTitle: A Special Presentation Related to the Movie! Little East Blue in Danger!
description: The Straw Hat Pirates visit Little East Blue, an island that recreates locations from the East Blue. As they enjoy nostalgic reminiscences of their hometowns, the peace is shattered when the Amigo Pirates arrive seeking Boss, a giant beetle who escaped from the Golden Lion Shiki.

events.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Little East Blue
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates arrive at Little East Blue, an island village that has recreated various locations from the East Blue to honor their homeland. The crew is immediately excited to see familiar settings from their pasts.
events.significance: Introduces the setting for the Little East Blue arc and establishes the nostalgic theme of the episodes leading into Strong World film.

events.title: Luffy Visits Windmill Recreation
events.description: Luffy explores a replica of the windmill from Foosha Village, his hometown. He reminisces about his childhood and the place where his journey began.
events.significance: Provides nostalgic callback to Luffy's origins and the beginning of the series.

events.title: Zoro Trains at Dojo Replica
events.description: Zoro visits a replica of a dojo similar to the one in Shimotsuki Village where he trained. He has flashbacks of training with Kuina and his promise to become the world's greatest swordsman.
events.significance: Nostalgic moment recalling Zoro's origins and his eternal rivalry and promise with Kuina.

events.title: Usopp Visits Mansion Replica
events.description: Usopp discovers a mansion similar to Kaya's mansion in Syrup Village. He reflects on his friendship with Kaya and the adventures that led him to join the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Nostalgic callback to Usopp's origins in Syrup Village and his friendship with Kaya.

events.title: Sanji Finds Baratie Recreation
events.description: Sanji discovers a restaurant recreating the Baratie, the floating restaurant where he worked under Chef Zeff. He has emotional flashbacks to his time there and the lessons Zeff taught him.
events.significance: Nostalgic moment honoring Sanji's past at the Baratie and his relationship with Zeff.

events.title: Nami Meets Her Fanclub
events.description: Nami encounters an enthusiastic fanclub of villagers who admire her. The Orenami fanclub welcomes her warmly.
events.significance: Light-hearted moment showing Nami's popularity among the Little East Blue residents.

events.title: Introduction of Little East Blue Residents
events.description: The main residents of Little East Blue are introduced: Mendo the teacher, Luigia the elderly woman, Mitsuboshi the cook, and Yoko, a young girl wearing a Marine cape who initially distrusts pirates.
events.significance: Establishes the key supporting characters for the Little East Blue arc.

events.title: Boss the Beetle Appears
events.description: Boss, a giant horned beetle with a Marine insignia painted on his shell, makes his first appearance. The residents explain that he is the island's protector and was befriended by Yoko after she found him in the forest.
events.significance: Introduces Boss, the central creature around which the arc's conflict revolves, as he is a creation of Shiki who escaped.

events.title: Yoko's Backstory Revealed
events.description: Yoko's tragic backstory is revealed: her father Ryudo was a Marine who defended Little East Blue alone and died five years ago at the hands of pirates. She now wears his uniform and protects the island with Boss, whom she befriended three years ago.
events.significance: Establishes Yoko's motivation and her initial distrust of pirates, setting up her character arc.

events.title: Amigo Pirates Surface
events.description: The Amigo Pirates emerge from the ocean in their submarine. The mariachi-styled pirate crew, led by brothers Largo and Corto, arrive at Little East Blue with hostile intentions.
events.significance: Introduces the primary antagonists of the Little East Blue arc who seek to recapture Boss for Shiki.

events.title: Corto Attacks Little East Blue
events.description: Corto and the Amigo Pirates begin their assault on Little East Blue, demanding that the villagers hand over Boss. They start destroying buildings and structures, causing chaos.
events.significance: Escalates the conflict and forces the Straw Hats to intervene to protect the island.

events.title: Luffy Intervenes to Protect Little East Blue
events.description: Luffy steps forward to confront Corto and the Amigo Pirates, refusing to let them destroy the peaceful island or capture Boss. The Straw Hats prepare to defend their new friends.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's characteristic heroism and sets up the main conflict of the arc.

events.title: Luffy vs Corto
events.description: Luffy engages in combat with Corto. The battle intensifies as Corto reveals he has Devil Fruit powers, though the specific nature is not yet fully disclosed.
events.significance: Initiates the direct confrontation between Luffy and one of the arc's main antagonists.

events.title: Largo Reveals Himself
events.description: Largo, the captain of the Amigo Pirates and Corto's brother, makes his dramatic entrance. He reveals himself to be the true leader and a significant threat.
events.significance: Introduces the main antagonist of the Little East Blue arc and raises the stakes of the conflict.

events.title: Largo's Ami Ami no Mi Revealed
events.description: Largo demonstrates the power of the Ami Ami no Mi (Net-Net Fruit), a Paramecia-type Devil Fruit that allows him to produce sticky nets from his body. He can create different types of nets by consuming various materials, giving them properties like metal or fire.
events.significance: First appearance of the Ami Ami no Mi Devil Fruit, an anime-original power that becomes the primary challenge for Luffy in this arc.

quotes.text: With these nets, I have a 120% capture rate!
quotes.speaker: Largo
quotes.context: Largo boasting about his Devil Fruit abilities

events.title: Largo Uses Mucho Neto Net
events.description: Largo uses his basic technique 'Mucho Neto Net', producing sticky web-like nets to attack and capture opponents. This is the fundamental ability of the Ami Ami no Mi.
events.significance: First demonstration of Largo's Devil Fruit technique in combat.

events.title: Largo Uses Mucho Cho Shi Mo
events.description: Largo consumes metal and then fires it from his hands as a barbed wire net, demonstrating his ability to create specialized nets by ingesting materials. The spiked metal net is far more dangerous than his basic sticky nets.
events.significance: Reveals the full versatility of the Ami Ami no Mi and its ability to create material-based nets.

events.title: Luffy Trapped in Spiked Net - Cliffhanger
events.description: The episode ends with Luffy caught in Largo's barbed wire net, unable to break free. The Straw Hats and villagers look on in shock as Largo stands victorious, setting up the continuation in the next episode.
events.significance: Creates dramatic tension and a cliffhanger ending that leads directly into episode 428.

quotes.text: With these nets, I have a 120% capture rate!
quotes.speaker: Largo
quotes.context: Largo boasting about his Ami Ami no Mi abilities

themes.description: The episode heavily emphasizes nostalgia as the Straw Hats revisit recreations of locations from their East Blue origins, reminding viewers of how far the crew has come.
themes.symbolism: Little East Blue itself serves as a symbol of the crew's humble beginnings and the bonds they formed in the East Blue.

themes.description: Luffy and the crew defend Little East Blue from the Amigo Pirates, demonstrating their heroic nature and willingness to protect peaceful communities.
themes.symbolism: The Straw Hats' defense of Little East Blue mirrors their past actions defending villages in the East Blue.

themes.description: Yoko's initial hatred of all pirates due to her father's death sets up a character arc about judging individuals rather than groups.
themes.symbolism: Yoko's Marine cape represents her father's legacy and her initial worldview that will be challenged.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his characteristic heroism by immediately defending Little East Blue, but ends the episode trapped and in danger.
keyActions: Explores windmill recreation and reminisces about Foosha Village
Confronts Corto to defend the island
Battles Largo and gets caught in his spiked net

characterSpotlights.role: Key supporting character and emotional anchor
characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a young girl who hates pirates due to her father's death, setting up her character arc.
keyActions: Reveals her backstory about her father

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as the captain of the Amigo Pirates with the formidable Ami Ami no Mi powers.
keyActions: Traps Luffy in barbed wire net
quotes: With these nets, I have a 120% capture rate!

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Little East Blue arc is anime-original content created to promote One Piece Film: Strong World and does not appear in the manga.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode of the Little East Blue arc, which was specifically created as a tie-in to One Piece Film: Strong World.

sources.title: Little East Blue Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode achieved an 11.3% TV rating in Japan, ranking 4th for its timeslot.
The opening song 'Kaze wo Sagashite' (Search for the Wind) by Mari Yaguchi with Straw Hats debuted in episode 426 and continued through episode 458.

sources.title: Kaze wo Sagashite - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This episode aired during a period when One Piece had no ending themes (from episode 279 to 1070), using extended opening sequences instead.

sources.title: One Piece Music - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Boss the beetle was created by Dr. Indigo for Shiki's plan to destroy East Blue, but escaped before being used.
The Ami Ami no Mi is an anime-only Devil Fruit that does not appear in the manga or any canon material.

sources.title: Ami Ami no Mi - One Piece Wiki
